content.question:
Figure 1. The distribution of individuals from two populations of the same species at different elevations

Researchers investigating two populations of the same species recorded the elevation at which individuals from each population were found (Figure 1).

Which of the following claims is best supported by the data in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Gene flow is likely to occur between the two populations because they share the same habitat.
Gene flow is likely to occur between the two populations because they are the same species.
Gene flow is unlikely to occur between the two populations because they compete for food.
Gene flow is unlikely to occur between the two populations because they are geographically isolated.

content.answer: Gene flow is unlikely to occur between the two populations because they are geographically isolated.
